website_summaries.verdict: Some users have water timer needs that go beyond gardening or lawn care. We recommend the Nelson water timer for tasks like pool replenishment, since it can be easily programmed for exceptionally short or long watering jobs. Nice mid-range price point.
pros: Very easy to program with analog and digital controls
LCD screen displays current time and future watering schedule
Flexible watering times from 1 minute to 6 hours
cons: Maximum recommended water pressure is only 60 psi
Water can penetrate LCD display box and other critical areas
LCD display draws battery power 24-7, requiring frequent replacement

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. This has been great to have for my garden during the drought conditions we had in Iowa last summer. It was good to have this for when I was on vacation a couple different times. Update: I've lowered my rating because the display started to go out the second year of ownership. Now I can't read the time to set the device. In hindsight, that display runs 24/7, which may be the problem. Nelson should consider implementing some sort of stand-by mode to extend the life of the display.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Buzalsky

customer_reviews.title: Nervous About Product
customer_reviews.text: First, the product is working fine. However, the instruction booklet describes all sorts of restrictions not mentioned in Amazon's product descriptions: 1) You must provide your own batteries (no biggie); 2) Maximum pressure is 60 psi; 3) not for use on outlet end of 'Y' connections or other hose accessories. I am violating both #2 (60 psi is pretty low) and #3. So far so good, but folks should be informed of these "restrictions".
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I've tried. I don't know what kind of metal they used on the upper connection point but it corrodes very quickly and no matter how much you tighten it, it leaks significantly while shut off. It's too bad. It's a very nice design otherwise and programming it and the features are very good. I just can't afford to pay for all the leaking water. It can't be good for the controller either that water is running down the back and over the battery compartment and maybe into the controller.
customer_reviews.author: J. Knittel

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Here's a great example of a product that looks simple enough but is of poor quality and zero customer support. After putting batteries in, the display started going haywire, batteries full, then zero, so I replaced the batteries with another new set. Same thing. Doesn't work. So you'd think Fiskars, the company that owns this garbage, might respond. 10 days ago, no response. Call their customer service? No luck, you get a recorded message with no ability to leave a message. I will never buy from Fiskars again.
customer_reviews.author: zl county

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to the other reviews LOL!
customer_reviews.text: This device is a complete waste of time and energy and will leave you hanging after you order it with a desperate alternative. The device, after 3 days showed error when I checked it. I had it set for five minutes each morning at 5 am. I pulled the batteries out and reprogrammed it and it worked for two more days. when I checked it today it was competley dead! It was also full of water! Listen to me and the others, this item is junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN K DAVIDSON

customer_reviews.title: LCD's gave out afer 16 months
customer_reviews.text: Initially this water timer worked great. I covered it with clear plastic to keep out water but it was still exposed to sun. After 16 months of daily use, the lcd's started going out. I have no clue as to the settings since I can't read them. It will still work on manual control but that's not good enough. I just bought an Instapark timer with a door over the screen and controls. Otherwise the dials look exactly like the Nelson model. Possibly it's made by the same company. Hope it lasts longer. Someone needs to put out a reliable timer that lasts more than a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: R. Houser

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY TRAY IS DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: My only beef with this product is that the unit constantly shuts itself off because there is some sort of defect in the battery tray causing it constantly lose electrical connection. No electric, no operation. When I manually press the tray in toward the body of the unit it works fine. This is either a design defect or I got a lemon. In either case I would never buy another one. The unit seems to be sturdy and well built otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Swissman564

customer_reviews.title: Good while it worked - like other reviews, stopped closing completely.
customer_reviews.text: These held up OK for a few seasons controlling well water with a high calcium content and lots of sediment to deal with, however after third season, one has failed (doesn't close completely). Battery lasts a long time (though I remove them each winter). The display is sensitive to heat and direct sunlight and blacks out. Product needs some improvements. Considering the durability - expect it to last only a couple of years. No repair or trouble shooting available.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Very Good quality timer. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The timer worked flawlessly for just over 2 years, then it suddenly quit. However, I give it 4 stars because it went through frequent heavy use under high water pressure conditions. Honestly, I put it through conditions they would invalidate the warranty. It held up longer than I expected. It’s a very good quality product for the amount I paid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Fresh batteries does no good, just poor quality control resulting in intermittent frequent ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these, but only put one to use. The second one was unopened, unused till now. The display kept dying randomly, so that I couldn't get even one watering cycle going. Fresh batteries does no good, just poor quality control resulting in intermittent frequent electronic malfunction. A piece of junk, as far as I am concerned. 50% reliability is no way to do business. Now it is way past return eligibility, so this bad unit wasted my money and many hours trying to get it to work by reprograming repeatedly. Strictly Orbit or Rain Birds from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Peide Xie

customer_reviews.title: Better quality water timer
customer_reviews.text: I am switching to Nelson because quality appears better than most. One simple feature stands out for me: the threaded connectors. Nelson has figured out how to make its equipment thread easily. Orvis is fussy to connect even when new, and after they get a bit calcified I have to use pliers.
customer_reviews.author: V. W. House

customer_reviews.title: Best in its class
customer_reviews.text: Super simple and straight forward to set and operate.Best of the reasonably priced battery operated drip system timers. We purchased one last year for our front system. It never failed once to operate as it is suppose to operate. When we set it to operate for this season, it worked without a hitch. Our timer for our back system failed to start this season. We did not have to think twice but went immediately to Amazon and ordered another of these great Nelson Timer w/Lcd Screen as a replacement. Installation was a snap. Programming was less than one minute. Very happy with durability, ease of use and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great Timer! I am pleased, just don't let it freeze in the winter!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this water timer. It Works great...and easy to program. I also like the look of this timer over other brands (not that it matters I guess)....I made the stupid mistake of not turning the water off when it got freezing out and I woke up with my back yard pretty wet LOL. It froze and busted the unit, but since it was my fault, I ordered another one. I have learned my lesson! The first one lasted all summer and I am sure it would have lasted many summers if I did not let it freeze this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: great addition for watering when there's no auto sprinkler system
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition for watering when the house does not have an automatic sprinkler system. I only wish it had a "day of the week" setting. If someone turns the dial to off, you have to wait until the day you want it to start to turn it back to auto again. It has a manual setting, which is handy, but a couple of hired workers started it manually and then shut it off, instead of waiting until the manual time ran out. That meant I had to wait till Thursday and hope to remember to turn it on again to water at 7pm. That "day of the week" setting would make this perfect!
customer_reviews.author: S. Donovan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: FAIL! This PoS didn't last a month of actual use! I hooked it up to the water system about the middle of June and less than 30 days later it is DEAD! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Highland Piper

customer_reviews.title: What an easy device to use--unlike many others
customer_reviews.text: What an easy device to use--unlike many others. I'd give it five stars, except that it uses an instant-on/instant-off switch, unlike the older Nelson timers that had a rotating ball valve. Ball valves turn the water on and off over the period of a few seconds. This one snaps it on/off, and if you've been running a large volume of water through it, the pipes in your home will shudder like they're about to explode. This is called "water hammer", and apparently it CAN break pipes. So...I limit the use of this particular device to very LOW flow applications. And for that purpose, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Moi Aussi

customer_reviews.title: Broke After a Few Months' Use
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months at the end of last season. Pulled it out of storage and plugged it in this year, and it started leaking from every opening. It was like it had hemorrhagic fever or something. Opened it up to see what was wrong, and the main water tube had lots of hairline cracks in it. So surprisingly enough, the electronics still work, but it failed due to cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: JMA

customer_reviews.title: Works great for one season and then fails
customer_reviews.text: Works great for one season and then fails. Consider it disposable. I only used it for a total of 2 weeks to water the area of my lawn that were overseeded. On the second season, water shot out of the holes on the bottom and the valve would no longer close. Additionally, the zinc threads corroded and made it difficult to screw onto the faucet. Would get 1 star, but it did work great for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: WGC

customer_reviews.title: Play time is over
customer_reviews.text: I have a precocious four-year-old who loves to play with water who is able to open the faucet valve and a loving, yet very forgetful spouse. I also had a mosquitos-breeding swamp after play time was over. I purchased this solely for the auto-off function. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: TigerTigerBurningBright

customer_reviews.title: Low Water Flow
customer_reviews.text: This timer restricts water flow tremendously. Hose directly on bib works amazing but as soon as I attached this to the bib and then to the hose my sprinkler barely has enough water flow to rotate. Returning this one and buying a different brand to see if that will work.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Ok for me, but I had to engineer it a little.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having trouble with the Lowe's water timer which after getting wet malfunctioned. Aren't these timers built for moisture? This Nelson timer was similar to the other timer I had but I gave it a shot anyways. After the first use it did get moisture inside of the display. I dried it out in a bag of rice and then applied a bead of silicone all the way around the timer. I have now been using it for 2 months without a problem!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Short

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Program and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased my second Nelson Timer of this make. I purchased the first three years ago, and it's still going strong. The timer is easy to program, and the manual override is very helpful in situations you may encounter. Very satisfied thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Worked for three months
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help establish my new sod last summer. It worked just fine. This spring I tried to use it and water started gushing out of the unit. I opened the housing thinking water may have frozen in the unit and cracked the interior pipe. Considering it only dipped below freezing about two times last winter I wasn't convinced this was the problem. Sure enough, the hardware inside the housing was fine. So I just tossed it in the bin. Rather expensive to be so short lived.
customer_reviews.author: adampeart

customer_reviews.title: liked how you could program it as well as manually ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well initially, liked how you could program it as well as manually run it. Usage for me was moderate, every other day for five minutes in an area with moderate sun exposure. However, I noticed that some of my plants were starting to look wilted. I turned to the unit and found that half of the screen was not working and it was no longer watering my plants. In an effort to fix it I changed the batteries with no avail. I would recommend purchasing a different timer, one that will last longer than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan & Juliett

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life . Very easy to program.
customer_reviews.text: Mine was purchased 2015 . Still working perfect. Changed battery once.
customer_reviews.author: sid Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: It is still running after two years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my drip irrigation on the back patio. We've used it everyday in watering season for two years. We remove it before it freezes. We've replaced the battery once. I'm buying another now for the front flower beds, but we're still using the original in the back.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Water damaged: poor battery & circuit board insulation
customer_reviews.text: Battery & circuit board got wet and killed it. The battery compartment is very poorly insulated from outside. Given this is outside all the time in the rain etc and of course, handles water, I would expect better isolation.
customer_reviews.author: LPDDS

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This timer works great! The yellow part that screws onto the hose is very heavy duty and water tight. Others I have tried tended to leak and have weak plastic fittings. Setting the timer is very easy and meets my need of being able to tell it when to start, how long to run at specific intervals. I really like the yellow button which will bypass the timer and allow hand watering. Then by pushing the button again, it returns to the schedule. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: stelban

customer_reviews.title: Greate timer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, if you are on a well you may have to remove the intake screen washer as mine plugged with particles. I did find a small reduction in water preasure when I have the timer in place.
customer_reviews.author: Percy R Bloodworth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for the same model. Works great and was very durable. Lasted a long time (several years). Simple to program. Set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product failed in the on position
customer_reviews.text: I generally love these timers but my whole perspective on the Nelson Programmable water time is now tenuous as I had one fail - and the failure mode left the valve open for most of a day. I can't wait to see my next water bill :( In addition, the seller/manufacturer never responded to my requests for a replacement and now my 30 day return period has expired. Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Trader

customer_reviews.title: The timer works great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The timer works great, easy to use, easy to program. Here's the big downside -- at least for me. The system has a narrow water flow, restricting the volume of water. This means the sprinkler attached to this time has a significantly smaller spray pattern. I have to move the sprinkler to cover one side of the yard, and then the other side. Ehhh...
customer_reviews.author: GadgetRick

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I needed it to do!!
customer_reviews.text: This things is awesome! It works very well. I planted new sod in the Spring, and had it not been for these timers, I don't think my sod would have made it through the summer. I like that you can set multiple programs, and it has a rain delay, or if you want to water outside of your scheduled program, you just push the button and can set it to run for a certain amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Satterwhite

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit back in June, and its already dead. Just got back after being on the road for a month and the LCD display shows gibberish and my lawn is brown. Tried replacing the batteries to no avail. What's the procedure for repair/replacement? Is there a better (more reliable) alternative?
customer_reviews.author: JLT

customer_reviews.title: Good water timer
customer_reviews.text: Worked well this past gardening season. I have brought it inside for the winter since that's what did in my previous timer. Anything that might have some water left in it doesn't last well in sub-freezing temps over the winter! I just need to re-read the manual to get the hang of all the control options. I really liked being able to schedule every other day.
customer_reviews.author: buttercup

customer_reviews.title: So far so good..
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... Timer is working well two weeks in activating and shutting off as programmed. I was looking for a timer for my sprinkler system that didn't reduce my water pressure (running six pop up sprinklers off this bad boy). No obvious reduction in pressure as is the case with other timers. The features could be better but for the money it's hard to beat. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David N

customer_reviews.title: Good timer, great value.  I will buy more.
customer_reviews.text: This timer has been working in my basement for almost a year now and I am very pleased with it. No leaks and it seems to keep pretty good time. All my plants are happier with regular watering, so that is good. My only complaint is that the hose fittings are off to the right side. I would have preferred a centered arrangement, but not a deal breaker by any measure.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the one. Trust me, I compared ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the one. Trust me, I compared screw on timers for many an afternoon and flipped past all of them. The other ones have inferior mechanisms and will fail on you, either flooding or droughting your plants. Luckily, Amazon's ratings led me here and I've been using this one for my garden since last mother's day.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Worked great all summer and it's easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this all summer for irrigation of my backyard hop plants on a schedule and it worked flawlessly. I didn't have babysit it other than checking my drip irrigation nozzles for plugging and the batteries lasted all summer as well. It's super simple to set and you can manually override with the press of a button. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Timer!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with a Soaker Hose for my garden for two months now and it works Great! I have it set to water for 1 hour at 6 AM and 6 PM. There is a Rain Delay feature with the press of a button, it will postpone the normal timed waterings by 1, 2, 3, or 4 days for when it is raining and I don't need the manual watering. This is such a Great Time and Water saver. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: KingCallahan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it. Easy to setup (instructions aren't needed), seems well made, attached easily and is intuitive. For those who say it doesn't last a season should trying reading aforementioned instructions - it has a TWO year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: WESIII

customer_reviews.title: Poster Child for Planned Obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: These last longer than the others and I have tried them all. Planned obsolescence in action! They could make ones that last forever, but that would eliminate multiple purchases. Frustrating. Easy to program.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G GTG Owner

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Problem-
customer_reviews.text: Check your Timer close when you get it, I purchased mine as a back up and didn't think much about it since it was in a sealed plastic no tamper package. However when I got ready to use it after return is no longer available (4 months since purchase) I open it and it does not have the dial shown here on the front so it's virtually unusable. Just didn't notice it.
customer_reviews.author: dclawso

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and configure
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older Nelson timer that developed an internal leak after many years of use. I use it in conjunction with a micro-spray system from Dripworks for a vegtable garden. Installed and operational in less than 4 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but shuts off very quickly
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but shuts off very quickly, creating a banging noise due to water-hammer in the plumbing. Not a big deal, but I installed a water-hammer arrester directly before the timer which eliminated the water-hammer. The minimum frequency for sprinkling is once every 6 hours. I wish it could be set to sprinkle more often (maybe every 3 hours), but the product works great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Bestrya

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just did some landscaping and this timer has been a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Payton

customer_reviews.title: Worked last summer for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Well just took two of these timers out of the garage where they been over the winter, hooked them up, turned on the water and got soaked, they sprayed everywhere. Leaking from everywhere. For 60 plus dollars for the two I only got to use them for 3 months..... Pissed
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Good timer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased four of these timers. Three worked fine, but one malfunctioned right out of the packaging. I called the manufacturer and was sent a replacement timer. These timers are easy to program. I have used another brand that did not last very long. I am hoping the timers will last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: It worked well for about a month.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for about a month. Then it stopped working. It was still under warranty and the manufacture was easy to deal with. In its defense, I have owned other brands with similar results. In my experience, this is the kind of thing that only works for a little while and then you buy another. Compared to similarly priced alternatives, this one performs on par. The problem is, none of them work for very long.
customer_reviews.author: WCP

customer_reviews.title: This is my second year and the timer runs like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This is my second year and the timer runs like a dream. I set it for 15 mins in the early am every other day.. You can forget about watering and go on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Howroyd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for unattended watering
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit about a month ago and have been very pleased with its performance. Super easy to setup and program, rain delay works well and the manual off/on function is intuitive. I tested it for a few days prior to going on vacation without issue. Still using the same batteries I initially installed. Kept my garden watered well while gone for two weeks. There is a couple psi drop in pressure using this vice not using it but it is so minute it really doesn't matter much. I only noticed it with my sprinkler as it lost about a foot of coverage with the drop, but again it was negligible. Five star product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: TXJaxon

customer_reviews.title: This product worked perfect.. I like that it's battery operated
customer_reviews.text: Went on vacation, so we needed something reliable to keep our flowers watered. This product worked perfect..I like that it's battery operated, and has a meter on telling you how much battery life you have left. It was very easy to set up and program. Will be getting another for my back patio.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vitola

customer_reviews.title: Amazon & Nelson--great!
customer_reviews.text: The Nelson 56607 Timer is easy to set up & functions just as it should! Digital display is easy to read, instructions for use are clear. Another great Nelson product! (And Amazon was great, too! Received the order on the 3rd day post-ordering! Free regular shipping)
customer_reviews.author: gercar

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sprinkler for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good timer and easy to use. I had another nelson that I actually liked more, but this will do in a pinch. It waters like it should and keeps battery life pretty well. I am on season 2 of the same batteries. It is also very water proof.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Huthsing

customer_reviews.title: Not for use with sprinkler
customer_reviews.text: This timer slows flow too much so it makes the sprinkler ineffective. Take the timer off and sprinkler works great. I have city utilities and great water pressure, so that's not it. It might work ok with soaker hose.
customer_reviews.author: jld

customer_reviews.title: There is a learning curve but the ability to water ...
customer_reviews.text: There is a learning curve but the ability to water for 6 hours was my reason for buying. I have the big heavy travelling tractor sprinklers that can pull that much hose. However, they do not have an auto shut-off feature. this solved my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one that was broken. The batteries had corroded. Easy to use and install. Just remember to remove the batteries if you store it during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: njl

customer_reviews.title: Piece of CRAP
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May 2018, now it is August 2018. Batteries died in about a month after I set it up, and so did my garden. Put in new batteries and now it is totally dead, and so is my garden again. Blank screen except for all of the water behind the glass. Only rains a couple of times a year here in Aridzona, but I guess that is more than this POS can take.
customer_reviews.author: Mesa Mike

customer_reviews.title: Leaks but getting another
customer_reviews.text: I have had this timer for 2 years now, and am ordering another because this one leaks pretty badly. I am getting another because it DID last 2 years and I think it's easy to program and is just what I need.
customer_reviews.author: M Love

customer_reviews.title: Great Timer!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this timer to use on my soaker hose system in my vegetable garden. Works perfectly. Comes on each day for set amount of time. Garden is watered and it shuts off. Couldn't ask for a better system. Easy dial to read and set. Just set it and forget about it. Simply put, this timer is great!
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Lover

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month and full with water from inside
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked for a month and then stopped. From the outside you can tell it is full with water. The display has water dripping from inside and when you shake it you can hear the water splashing inside. When I tried placing new batteries and random segments on the display get lit up.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley I

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: very bed pressure. pressure after this timer drops dramatically. couldn't use at all.
customer_reviews.author: gio

customer_reviews.title: No more dead plants
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of these now for a few years. Watering a drip irrigation system is very easy with this (or the garden). All you have to do is replace the batteries once they start dying. No issues at all other than that. Perfect
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Love it, would buy it again any time
customer_reviews.text: Works Greeeeaaaat! Love it, would buy it again any time! Easy to use and turn on and off for everyday watering of plants not on the drip system.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Timer!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The easiest device I've ever programed! Gives you a ton of different setting options too.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: turns on and off for specified period to water ... until such time as you reset start time, run time & day (which is very easy)
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Burks

customer_reviews.title: It will not last more than a season.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted just one season. Everything was fine until I set it up for this year. Started with a small leak and after a couple of days, it is leaking all thrught the seams. It is now useless. To make thing worst, Nelson does not have - or it is hidden - a consumer comments/complaints line. I must say that the unit was kept indoors during the mild winter and never bellow 50 F.
customer_reviews.author: Vitor Warwar

customer_reviews.title: Good value, functions well, easier than some to set up, you might not even need the manual
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy (unlike others) to replace the regular AA batteries, no screw-driver needed. Like all plastic and many metal based timers do NOT expect to leave this out year-round, it will surely burst in any freezing temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought first one 5 years ago. Still working great. Screen on first on is yellowed from sun but still working great. New one worked just as well this season. Expect many more. Getting ready to buy number 3.
customer_reviews.author: S. Norte

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: One of the timers won’t program. This is the first one that don’t program. Send me another one.
customer_reviews.author: james mccolloch

customer_reviews.title: Good product, simple controls
customer_reviews.text: Controls so simple, even a dolt could use them easily (I won't name the dolt). We'll see how it holds up over time but, so far, this is superior to units that cost twice the money.
customer_reviews.author: MaxNYC

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Needed the timer to water a newly seeded area while on vacation. It works great. I wish I had bought one a long time ago.
